findings.title: Accommodation of Non-ERC20-Compliant Tokens
findings.description: The `transfer` function does not have a return value for certain non-compliant ERC20 tokens (e.g., USDT), which can cause reverts when calling `transfer` with an expected return value.

findings.title: Suggested Use Of nonReentrant In mint()
findings.description: The function mint() does not adhere to the checks-effects-interactions principle, making it vulnerable to re-entrancy attacks. It is recommended to add the nonReentrant modifier.

findings.title: Lack Of Authentication For Privilege Functions
findings.description: In the BSD protocol, the owner account plays a critical role in governing and regulating the entire operation and maintenance. It also has the privilege to transfer funds from the polPoolAddr, the pusdPoolAddr, and the pnxPoolAddr to any addresses. The setPOLPrice() function is defined with a public modifier without proper authentication.

findings.title: Logic Error Of burn()
findings.description: The logic behind the burn function allows users to bypass the check of having enough pUSD tokens by calling receivePnxToBurn() function.
